title: GerminaR
code: label %>%    label_print(mode = "preview")

title: GerminaR
code: sticker <- label %>%   label_print(filename = "GerminaR"               , margin = 0               , paper = c(5.5, 5.5)               , mode = "complete"               )

title: GerminaR
text: Import image pdf format cut border make panel_color transparent.
code: sticker %>%    image_read_pdf()  %>%    image_crop(geometry = "600x600+40") %>%   image_crop(geometry = "560x600-40") %>%   image_transparent('blue') %>%    image_write("GerminaR.png")

title: Huito
text: La calidad de datos inicia desde la colecta de la información, y en muchos casos se le presta la debida importancia este proceso. El desarrollo de etiquetas puede ayudar reducir el error en la colecta y también acelerar el análisis de los datos ([Figure @fig-kix.vd7qxjm1q38u]:).

title: Huito
text: Huito permite el desarrollo de etiquetas reproducibles y personalizadas de acuerdo los requerimientos del usuario. Cada elemento en la etiqueta es adicionado por capas, respetando el orden de acuerdo su jerarquía en el código. (#fig:fig-kix.vd7qxjm1q38u)Proceso de etiquetado y colecta de datos de experimentos. Los códigos QR permiten la colecta de datos con un dispositivo móvil de forma rápida y sencilla.

title: Labels
text: fieldbook experimental design deployed inti package https://inkaverse.com/articles/apps.html
code: library(inti)  treats <- data.frame(condition = c("irrigated", "drought")                      , genotypes = c("choclito", "salcedo", "pandela", "puno"))  design <- tarpuy_design(data = treats                         , nfactors = 2                         , type = "rcbd"                         , rep = 3                         , barcode = "HUITO")   fb <- design$fieldbook  fb %>% web_table()

title: Labels
text: can change layer dynamically based column. case, color text condition change based treatments: “blue” irrigated “red” drought. running chunk first time. comment huito_fonts() already imported fonts.
code: library(huito)  font <- c('Ceviche One', "Permanent Marker")  huito_fonts(font)  label <- fb %>%    mutate(color = case_when(     condition %in% "irrigated" ~ "blue"     , condition %in% "drought" ~ "red"   )) %>%    label_layout(size = c(10, 2.5)                , border_color = "blue"                ) %>%   include_image(     value = "https://flavjack.github.io/inti/img/inkaverse.png"     , size = c(2.4, 2.4)     , position = c(1.2, 1.25)     , opts = "image_scale(200)"     ) %>%   include_barcode(      value = "barcode"      , size = c(2.5, 2.5)      , position = c(8.2, 1.25)      ) %>%   include_text(value = "plots"                , position = c(9.7, 1.25)                , angle = 90                , size = 15                , color = "red"                ) %>%   include_text(value = "Inkaverse"                , position = c(4.6, 2)                , size = 30                , color = "brown"                , font[1]                ) %>%   include_text(value = "condition"                , position = c(4.6, 1.2)                , size = 13                , color = "color" # dynamic column                , font[2]                ) %>%   include_text(value = "genotypes"                , position = c(4.6, 0.5)                , size = 13                , color = "#009966"                , font[2]                )

title: Labels
text: preview mode label_print(mode = "preview") generate example label design random row data set.
code: label %>%    label_print(mode = "preview")

title: Labels
text: want generate complete labels list, change: label_print(mode = "complete").
code: label %>%    label_print(mode = "complete", filename = "etiquetas", nlabels = 10)

title: Stickers
code: label %>%    label_print(mode = "preview")

title: Stickers
code: sticker <- label %>%    label_print(filename = "huito"               , margin = 0               , paper = c(5.5, 5.5)               , mode = "complete"               )

title: Stickers
text: Import image pdf format cut border make panel_color transparent.
code: sticker %>%    image_read_pdf()  %>%    image_transparent("blue") %>%    image_crop(geometry = "600x600+40") %>%   image_crop(geometry = "560x600-40") %>%      image_write("huito.png")

text: Lozano-Isla F (2022). huito: Reproducible Flexible Label Design. https://huito.inkaverse.com/, https://github.com/flavjack/huito.
code: @Manual{,   title = {huito: Reproducible and Flexible Label Design},   author = {Flavio Lozano-Isla},   year = {2022},   note = {https://huito.inkaverse.com/, https://github.com/flavjack/huito}, }

title: Huito
text: ‘Huito’ open-source R package deploys reproducible flexible labels using layers. ‘huito’ package part ‘inkaverse’ project developing different procedures tools used plant science experimental designs. Learn ‘inkaverse’ project https://inkaverse.com/.

title: Huito
text: can install released version huito CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("huito") if (!require("remotes"))   install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Flavjack/huito")

title: Barcode generator — barcode_qr
text: Generate bar codes using QR codes

title: Barcode generator — barcode_qr
code: barcode_qr(text, color = "black", alpha = 1, ecl = "H")

title: Barcode generator — barcode_qr
text: text text convert QR bar code color Bar code color alpha Intensity bar code color ecl Error correction level (percentage). "L" (7), "M" (15), "Q" (25) "H" (30). Defaults "H"

title: Fieldbook experimental design — fieldbook
text: dataset obtained using inti package. data set randomize complete block design (RCBD) three replications.

title: Fieldbook experimental design — fieldbook
text: data frame 24 rows 5 variables:  barcode barcode experimental unit plots Plot number block Blocks (3): number replication design condition Factor two levels: irrigated drought genotypes Factor four levels: choclito, salcedo, pandela, puno

title: Shape layer — include_shape
text: label label output (table) value type shape (string: "hexagon") size shape size (numeric: 5.08) position position coordinate (numeric: NA) border_color image color (string: "black") border_width shape line width (numeric: 1) background background color (string: "red") units units shape (string: "cm") panel_color panel color (string: NA) panel_size panel size (numeric: NA)

title: Shape layer — include_shape
text: data frame

title: Shape layer — include_shape
code: library(huito)  label <- label_layout(data = NA                , size = c(10, 2.5)                , background = "yellow"                ) %>%          include_shape(                value = "hexagon"                , position = c(1.2, 1.25)                , background = "red"                , border_width = 1                , size = 2.4                #, panel_size = 2.4*1.157175                )                 label %>% label_print("sample")   ts <- label$opts

text: data data frame build labels size label size (numeric: c(10, 2.5)) border_width border width (numeric: 0.5) border_color border color (string: "transparent") background background color (string: "transparent") units units label options (string: "cm")

title: Label print — label_print
text: Generate labels based data frame

title: Label print — label_print
code: label_print(   label,   mode = "sample",   filename = "labels",   margin = 0.04,   paper = c(21, 29.7),   units = "cm",   viewer = FALSE,   smpres = 200,   nlabels = NA )

title: Label print — label_print
text: label Data frame build labels n repeated labels (table/numeric) mode Label generation (string: "sample/preview", "complete") filename Labels file name (string: "labels") margin Labels margins. margin(numeric vector: t = 0, r = 0, b = 0, l = 0) paper Paper size. Default A4 (numeric vector: 21.0 x 29.7) units Units label options (string: "cm") viewer Visualization label (logial: FALSE) smpres Sample resolution viewer = TRUE (numeric: 200) nlabels Number labels generate (numeric: NA)

title: Label print — label_print
text: pdf

title: Label print — label_print
code: library(huito)  fb <- fieldbook  label <- fb %>%  label_layout(size = c(10, 2.5)              , border_color = "blue"              ) %>%   include_image(     value = "https://flavjack.github.io/inti/img/inkaverse.png"     , size = c(2.4, 2.4)     , position = c(1.2, 1.25)     ) %>%   include_barcode(     value = "barcode"     , size = c(2.5, 2.5)     , position = c(8.2, 1.25)     ) %>%   include_text(value = "plots"                , position = c(9.7, 1.25)                , angle = 90                , size = 15                , color = "red"                ) %>%   include_text(value = "Inkaverse"                , position = c(4.6, 2)                , size = 30                , color = "brown"                ) %>%   include_text(value = "condition"                , position = c(4.6, 1.2)                , size = 13                , color = "orange"                ) %>%   include_text(value = "genotypes"                , position = c(4.6, 0.5)                , size = 13                , color = "#009966"                ) %>%                 label_print(mode = "sample")
